column2: Dropbox Uploader is a BASH script which can be used to upload, download, list or delete files from Dropbox, an online file sharing, synchronization and backup service.

column5: message

Merge pull request #465 from jasonc/http-status-code-change-fix

Allow for HTTP 2 Status Codes.

Allow for HTTP 2 Status Codes.

The DropBox web servers have started sending HTTP 2 Status Codes.

Example of a previous status code:
  HTTP/1.1 200 OK

Example of the current status code:
  HTTP/2 200

This change allows for either version of the codes to be accepted.

Merge pull request #434 from scotia70/master

Allow for filenames containing more than a single contiguous space

Update dropbox_uploader.sh

ARG expansion with multiple contiguous spaces results in a single space unless $ARGx is wrapped in quotes.  This patch permits files with more than one contiguous space in a filename.  eg. "Test  File"
Fix bug #422: Re-asks for token

Merge pull request #319 from nivit/freebsd-use-coreutils

Use greadlink (coreutils) also for FreeBSD

Use greadlink (coreutils) also for FreeBSD

Dropbox Uploader needs greadlink from coreutils under FreeBSD.
This patch is already included in the FreeBSD port.
(see https://svnweb.freebsd.org/ports/head/net/dropbox-uploader/Makefile?revision=421172&view=markup )

Merge pull request #155 from dandv/patch-1

Typo fixes

Mention where the files land if you pick the "app" permission

I've just configured Dropbox-Uploader and uploaded a file to a specific path:

    dropbox_uploader.sh upload QS_Forum_backup_2014-07-16T20-00.zip "QS Forum Backups/QS_Forum_backup_2014-07-16T20-00.zip"

However, the file landed in `/Apps/QSForum Uploader` (the name of the app I created), and only under that in the `QS Forum Backups` subdir.

Mention the configuration wizard

Somehow it wasn't mentioned anywhere

Merge pull request #45 from pjv/optional-config-file

Allow multiple config files for different dropboxes

Add optional command-line parameter ('-f') to read dropbox config information (APPKEY, APPSECRET, etc) from a specific file allowing the script to support multiple dropbox destinations.

New usage looks like this for example: ./dropbox_uploader.sh -f myDBConfig upload /path/to/file
